structure.unit: ESCAPE AND OTHER OFFENSES RELATING TO CUSTODY

text.section: A person is guilty of escape in the second degree when he escapes from a detention facility or, being charged with or convicted of a felony, he escapes from custody.
Escape in the second degree is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 171, effective January 1, 1975.
